fields.Title of Contribution: We're in this together: Student motivation and faculty support in online degree advancement during the COVID-19 pandemic
fields.Journal: The International Journal of Learning in Higher Education
fields.Description/Abstract: The purpose of this study was to identify the motivation for continued learning and degree attainment in online degree advancement (DA) Respiratory Care students during a pandemic and the types of support needed for academic success in the online learning environment. The design of the study was mixed methods descriptive survey research. Components of the Academic Motivations Scale (AMS)- College Version were used to assess the construct, as well as open-ended questions that allowed for narrative student responses related to pressures of the pandemic, regulation of motivation, and faculty support. One-hundred twenty-three students completed components of the survey. Respondents were both intrinsically and extrinsically motivated to continue to pursue their advanced degree despite the pandemic. Students self-identified as being determined to achieve their goals; support from family, friends, colleagues and faculty helped them achieve their goals; and flexibility of instructors helped to ensure student success during the pandemic. Despite the pandemic, Respiratory Therapy (RT) students pursuing an advanced degree are self-determined and have a genuine love of learning, which helps to regulate their motivation to continue. DA students in Respiratory Care appreciated instructors who were flexible and supportive in meeting their academic needs.
